reviews.text: Friendly staff and a clean place to stay. Everything within driving distance. 1 & 2 bedroom units come with a full kitchen & washer & dryer. Only complaint was the Jacuzzi near the main pool was out of order & BBQ grill on the balcony was dirty.
reviews.title: Would return

reviews.text: The WorldMark at Windsor California was perfect for our wine country touring. My husband and I stayed with another couple and found that we had all the amenities that we needed, and the location was perfect. We would definately stay there again, especially if the price is as good as we got last time.
reviews.title: Loved the WorldMark

likes.disliked: — Could hear people moving around outside the unit in the mornings.

reviews.text: We had a great stay here over Barrel weekend. We drove up from SF on Saturday, stoped at a few wineries and stopped in to see if our room might be ready early (1pm). It was...yeaah.
reviews.title: quiet place to relax

reviews.text: We got a 2 bedroom unit on the corner, building 8. the resort was fairly busy with many of the parking spaces filled. the pools were heated and in use for most of the day.
reviews.title: Had a lovely stay

likes.disliked: — Wireless internet not free...but reasonably priced

reviews.text: Each unit is started with needed supplies to start the week. dirty towels and sheets can be exchanged daily from 8 to 6 at the turn-in point.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one week after trading with RCI. The hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful. Our 2 BR room was well furnished and very comfortable. We especially enjoyed having our own gas barbeque on the patio, and internet access via an ethernet router in your room was available for the whole week for only $15. The only negative is the parking situation. If you go out at night, you will have a hard time finding a parking space close to your room when you get back.
reviews.title: Great home base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Windsor is in a great location, located centrally in Sonoma Valley, making this an ideal place to use as a home base for winery tours. The town of Windsor is immaculate. It reminded us of Disney's Main Street USA, it was so perfect. We really liked the Sunday farmers market for fresh local produce. The town is a 45 minute walk from the resort, if you're looking for a little exercise.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

reviews.text: My husband and I travelled with my sister-in-law and her husband, and reserved a two-bedroom unit. This is a perfect place to stay of you want to experience wine country and a little bit of San Francisco. We stayed for 7 days and had a great time. We toured Napa Valley on our own and found it very easy to get to from Sonoma. We did a wine tour with Platypus Tours, which was great! We chose to tour the Russian River Valley and they picked us up from the main building at the Windsor. We did San Francisco one day in the middle of the week. It was about an hour from Sonoma to SFO. On our last day/night we chose to spend the day in Salsalito and spend the night at the Airport Marriott because we had a 6:00am flight back home.
reviews.title: Great Place - great location

reviews.text: The employees at the Windsor were so very nice. Check in was easy and they put a packet together for us, so we would have lots of restaurants and wineries to choose from. I am so sad that we did not get to go to Johnny Garlic's. (We just never got a chance to get there.) However, we were directed to this cute little restaurant in downtown Sonoma and we ate there everyday, and we got a 10% discount everyday for staying at the Windsor.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Getaway

reviews.text: The unit was very nice. Everything was clean and comfortable. One night we used the grill and had a great time drinking wine and sitting out on the balcony. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything you need to cook with. The great thing was that you did not have to clean out the refrigerator when you left. Some timehsares require that you expose of everything you brought with you, but the Windsor did not. They told us that the clean up crew would take what was unopened and throw away the rest. We felt good that the items we did not use would not go to waste.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, excellent accomodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place exceeded our expectations. We wanted to travel to an area that had lot's of things to do. We stayed at WorldMark in a one-bedroom condo. The decor was in keeping with the surrounding wine country. It was a delight to settle in for a week in such a beautiful place. The staff was overly friendly and helpful. The entire resort was immaculate and well managed. It's nice to be able to prepare your own meals or dine out.
reviews.title: Beautiful Sunny Northern California

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shopping was a few short blocks away over the bridge covering Highway 101. The town of Winsor was a short distance and worth the trip to find unique shops and the Farmer's Market at the Park. Perfect place to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary.
reviews.title: Fabulous property

reviews.text: We are from UK and stayed here for a week on a timeshare swap. On arrival we were welcomed by avery smart young man on reception who speedily checked us in and then gave us a quick tour of the public area. Our apt was a 2-bedroom 2bath on the 2nd floor. It was very clean and well equipped; the gas BBQ on the balcony was well used as was the jacuzzi assigned to our block (there is a jacuzzi at each block as well as the ones by the main pool). Internet acces was good and well worth the small 1 week fee.
reviews.title: Great Choice in Windsor
Great Trip
reviews.text: The location was in a very quiet area but with easy acces to the freeway and to the Napa & Sonoma Valleys. We had many pleasant drives around the local vineyards and towns.
There were plenty of grocery stores nearby and also a good choice of restaurants. Charleys at the golf course next door was very pleasant if a little pricey.
reviews.title: Worldmark Windsor great for couples traveling together

likes.disliked: — bedrooms too warm at night, air didn't seem to flow when doors were closed

reviews.text: We stayed at the property in early December - very quiet time. We had a 2 bedroom on the ground level - easy access to parking. It was too cold for pool, but no time as we spent most of the time with our family in Windsor.
reviews.title: Better than a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rate was so low, I was afraid of what we might be getting into. The rate was lower than an hotel in the area and had more amentities.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect Stay
Nice exchange through RCI
reviews.text: I looked at availability for this Summer - good luck! It appears we stayed there at a slow time, but glad we know it is there for future trips.

We did have problems with the furnace - one bedroom was freezing, while the rest of the unit was so hot. The second bedroom was supposed to be 1 queen, but had 2 singles. The front desk couldn't do anything about this.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

likes.disliked: — Hard to say, can't think of anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some noise in the am in the parking lot, but bearable. I will note that there is not a lof of "service". If you are looking for room service, maid service, maint., etc. - this is not your place.
reviews.title: Not very stylish timeshare but nice location
